Q_DESC:
Given an array, find maximum sum of smallest and second smallest elements chosen from all possible sub-arrays. More formally, if we write all (nC2) sub-arrays of array of size >=2 and find the sum of smallest and second smallest, then our answer will be maximum sum among them.

Input:
The first line of input  contains an integer N denoting the size of the array. The next line contains N space separated values of the array.

Output:
 In  a new line print an integer denoting the maximum sum of smallest and second smallest elements chosen from all possible subarrays.

Constraints:
2<=N<=100
1<=A[]<=100
TESTCASE_1:
6
12 13 1 10 34 1
###---###SEPERATOR---###---
The sum of smallest and second smallest element is 11
TESTCASE_2:
5
8 1 9 2 7
###---###SEPERATOR---###---
The sum of smallest and second smallest element is 3
